Function Documentation

unsigned short int add_qgram_to_index ( char *  qgram,
int  start_position_paramater 
)

Checks if the given start position for the given qgram is a new one and stores it in the corresponding struct of the qgram_hash.

Parameters:
qgram the qgram
start_position_paramater start position to be added to the qgram
Returns:
0 if the qgram is new, 1 if a read is updated with a new position

References qgram_hash::next_pos, pos_counter, qgram_hash::positions, qgram_hash::qgram, and qgram_lookup().

unsigned int *  alignment_queue,
int  possible 
)

Checks if the given start position for the given read is a new one and stores it in the corresponding struct of the result_hash.

Parameters:
read_id unique number of the read
start_position start position to be added to the read
direction_and_qgrams holds the direction and the matching qgram(s)
results reference to the result hash of this thread
alignment_queue reference to the alignment queque of this thread
Returns:
0 if the read is new, 1 if the start position already exists and 2 if a read is updated with a new position

short int perform_hashtable_identity_check ( void   ) 

Performs an self check of the qgram_hash i.e. iterate over the hash and check each key for existence

Returns:
0 if check is passed, 1 otherwise

Starts the SEASHORE mapping algorithm

Parameters:

run number of the actual run

qgram_length length of one qgram
error maximal allowed error
rest rest of the read after beeing cut into X qgrams
do_reverse determines the direction of this run
data_array array holding the qgram to read mapping
results the result hash for the correspondig thread
alignment_queue holds the number of alignments in queue
data_array_offsets start positions for each qgram's start positions
Returns:
nothing
